intro: Chailletia longipetala, commonly known as the long-petioled chailletia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and features palmate leaves with long petioles. Its floral structure includes five petals and is pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
